oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Saatgutvitalität von elektronenbehandeltem Getreidesaatgut im Kalttest
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Matthes, Christoph
Geier, Uwe
Spieß, Hartmut
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
Values, standards and certification
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: To examine the use of low energy electrons as a method of seed dressing in ecologi¬cal agriculture, especially concerning its influence on seed vitality, samples of wheat, rye and barley were investigated by testing germination vigour under cold stress and by Bio crystallisation methods. Lowered germination speed indicated a decrease of seed vitality. Alterations of growth, like disturbance of gravitropism and an increased root:leaf ratio prove a significant impairment of the embryo by electron treatment. Results of biocristallisation and capillary dynamolysis indicate a loss of vital quality.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Matthes, Christoph; Geier, Uwe and Spieß, Hartmut (2007) Saatgutvitalität von elektronenbehandeltem Getreidesaatgut im Kalttest. [Seed vitality of electron treated grain in cold-test germination.] Paper at: Zwischen Tradition und Globalisierung - 9. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, Universität Hohenheim, Stuttgart, Deutschland, 20.-23.03.2007.
